summary: Implementation is solid and follows the tech-spec closely. The failover interceptor correctly ports the web apiLooper pattern. Code is well-structured with clear separation: ApiConfig (data), EndpointHealthTracker (state), ApiFailoverInterceptor (behavior), NetworkClient (factory). Minor improvements suggested below.

findings.finding: getNextHealthyEndpoint and getFirstHealthyEndpoint have identical implementations. getNextHealthyEndpoint has an unused parameter suppressed with @Suppress annotation.
findings.suggestion: Remove getFirstHealthyEndpoint to reduce dead code.

findings.finding: Thread.sleep() is used for retry delay on the interceptor thread. Acceptable for OkHttp interceptors since they run on background threads.
NetworkClient had both @Inject constructor and a @Provides in module, creating double-provision.
findings.suggestion: Removed @Inject from NetworkClient since module handles provision.

findings.finding: API endpoints are hardcoded constants. Correct per Decision 10.

spec_compliance: Implementation matches tech-spec requirements: round-robin failover, 500ms queuing, in-memory health tracking, HTTPS-only validation, private IP blocking.
